health_good_msg: Your connection looks healthy. All values are within normal range.
health_marginal_msg: Some values are outside the ideal range. This may not affect your internet experience yet, but is worth monitoring.
health_poor_msg: One or more values are critically out of range. You may experience connection issues such as slow speeds, dropouts, or high latency.
issue_ds_power_critical_desc: Signal level is outside -8 to +20 dBmV range. This usually indicates a cabling or amplifier problem. Contact your ISP if the issue persists.
issue_us_power_critical_desc: Transmit power is outside 35-53 dBmV range. Your modem is working too hard to reach the provider. Check cable connections or request a signal check from your ISP.
issue_us_power_warn_desc: Transmit power is outside 41-47 dBmV range. May indicate signal loss on the line. Monitor this value over time.
issue_snr_critical_desc: SNR below 25 dB causes packet loss and connection instability. Common causes: damaged coax cable, loose connectors, or interference from splitters.
issue_snr_warn_desc: SNR below 33 dB (ideal: above 33 dB). Connection works but has reduced margin for error. Consider checking cable quality.
issue_uncorr_errors_high_desc: Over 10,000 uncorrectable errors detected. These cannot be recovered and cause data loss. If this number grows rapidly, contact your ISP.
no_data: No data available for this period.
modem_user_hint: Tip: Create a dedicated user for DOCSight instead of using your main admin account.
snapshot_hint: Reference time for daily comparisons and trends
mqtt_desc: For Home Assistant integration via MQTT Auto-Discovery. Without MQTT only the web UI runs.
export_hint: Copy this text and paste it into your favorite LLM (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, ...) for connection insights.
export_no_data: No data available yet. Wait for the first poll.
login_hint: Enter the admin password to access DOCSight.
bqm_url_hint: Paste your ThinkBroadband BQM share link (.png)
bqm_no_data: No BQM graph for this date.
card_no_docsis31: No DOCSIS 3.1 upstream channel found. May depend on your plan or equipment.
card_errors_note: Uncorrectable errors cannot be recovered. High growing numbers indicate a cable issue.
tip_ds_power: Signal Level measures how strong the signal from your provider arrives. Ideal is close to 0 dBmV. Too high or too low means a cable or amplifier issue â€” like a TV picture that's too bright or too dark.
tip_snr: Signal Clarity (SNR) is like radio reception quality. High values = crystal-clear signal. Low values = static and interference, which causes buffering and dropouts.
tip_transmit_power: This is how loudly your modem has to 'shout' to reach your provider. If it's too high, there's probably a cable problem â€” similar to shouting into a bad phone connection.
tip_uncorrectable: These are data packets that were damaged during transmission and could NOT be repaired. They cause buffering, lag in games, or broken video calls.
tip_correctable: These packets arrived damaged but were automatically repaired. A few are normal, but high numbers are an early warning sign of cable issues.
tip_download: Your actual download speed compared to what you're paying for. Below 80% of your booked speed may indicate a problem.
tip_upload: Your actual upload speed compared to what you're paying for. Important for video calls, cloud backups, and streaming.
report_description: Generate a PDF report with signal data, worst values, and a pre-written ISP complaint letter.
bqm_setup_intro: BQM by ThinkBroadband monitors your connection quality by pinging your public IP from external servers. DOCSight can display BQM graphs alongside your modem data for a complete picture.
bqm_setup_benefit_1: Independent proof of connection issues (not just modem-side)
bqm_setup_benefit_2: Tracks latency, packet loss, and throughput 24/7
bqm_setup_benefit_3: Strengthens ISP complaints with third-party evidence
bqm_setup_step_1: Set up DynDNS on your router (e.g. MyFRITZ! on Fritz!Box) so BQM can find your IP
bqm_setup_step_2: Enable WAN ping/ICMP on your router so it responds to external pings (Fritz!Box: Internet â†’ Permit Access â†’ tick "Respond to ping")
bqm_setup_step_3: Go to thinkbroadband.com/broadband/monitoring, create a free account, and register your DynDNS address
bqm_setup_step_4: Once monitoring is active, copy your Share URL (ends in .png) and paste it in DOCSight Settings â†’ BQM Share URL
report_customer_hint: Optional: Add your details for the complaint letter
report_edit_hint: Review and edit the complaint letter below. Copy it to send via email, or download the full technical report as PDF attachment.
speedtest_url_hint: Base URL of your Speedtest Tracker instance
speedtest_token_hint: Bearer token from Speedtest Tracker settings
booked_download_hint: Contracted download speed in Mbps for health calculation
booked_upload_hint: Contracted upload speed in Mbps for health calculation
speedtest_setup_intro: Speedtest Tracker is a self-hosted app that runs periodic Ookla speed tests. DOCSight can display your speed test results alongside modem signal data for a complete picture of your connection.
speedtest_setup_benefit_1: Track actual download/upload speeds over time
speedtest_setup_benefit_2: Correlate speed drops with DOCSIS signal issues
speedtest_setup_benefit_3: Independent proof of speed issues for ISP complaints
speedtest_setup_step_2: In Speedtest Tracker, go to Settings → API and create an API token
speedtest_setup_step_3: Paste your Speedtest Tracker URL and API token in DOCSight Settings
no_incidents: No incidents logged yet. Start documenting your connection issues to build a history for ISP complaints.
confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this incident?
invalid_file_type: File type not allowed. Allowed: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP, PDF, TXT
event_no_events: No events detected yet. Events are generated automatically when signal conditions change.
signal_no_snapshot: No signal snapshot found within 2 hours of this speedtest.
no_channel_data: No data available for this channel.
